intro: Solenopsis minuta subsp. balearica, commonly known as the Balearic fire ant, is a small, tropical ant species native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the genus Solenopsis, which includes various species of fire ants known for their aggressive behavior and ability to form large colonies. This subspecies is characterized by its dark reddish-brown coloration and a slender body structure. It typically inhabits dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. The plant aspect of this subspecies is not applicable, as it is an ant, not a plant.
